result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Maxwell Scott Holden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Maxwell Scott Holden is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Maxwell Scott Holden was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
1) The defendant will have no further contacts w/law enforcement during term of agrmt. that give rise to probable cause for arrest due to criminal conduct.
2)Defendant shall notify Pepin County District Attorney's Office of any change of residence or employment.
3)One month prior to completion of contract, defendant must contact Pepin County District Attorney's Office for a final interview.
4)Report in person as requested by the Pepin County District Attorney or other supervisor designated by him.
5) The defendant must follow the rules and regulations as set forth by probation, if applicable.
ADDITIONAL CONDITIONS:
A.  I will cooperate with law enforcement and provide truthful testimony against any and all codefendants in this matter.
B.  I understand that a probation violation will be considered a violation of this agreement.  I will immediately inform the DA's office of any probation violations.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

miscConds.notes:
Pay costs/surcharges according to a schedule as set forth by Probation & Parole.
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes: Serve 5 days in the Pepin County Jail.

AMENDED 01-02-2018:  Court amends condition of probation to add 20 days in the Pepin County Jail commencing 02-23-2018 unless by that date all court ordered obligations are paid in full to the Department of Corrections and verified with the Court.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Maxwell Scott Holden

records.addlTxt: Motion granted, count 1 is hereby dismissed without prejudice.

Defendant Maxwell Scott Holden in court.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court informs defendant here on Probation Review Hrg. to address unpaid court ordered obligations as nearing discharge; court can either extend probation or order additional jail if don't pay; if don't pay could also be in violation of DPA.  Court amends condition of probation to add 20 days jail to commence 2/23/18 at 6:00 p.m. unless by that date all court ordered obligations are paid in full to the DOC and verified.
Probation review hearing on January 2, 2018 at 10:30 am.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Court advises defendant of elements/max. penalties of count 1 and count 2; advises defendant of felony prohibitions if convicted of felony; reviews DPA with defendant.  To count 2, defendant pleads guilty; to count 1 false imprisonment defendant pleads guilty;  Court reviews PLQ/WOR form with defendant. Court advises defendant of his constitutional rights; finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights and plea done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts plea in count 2 and finds defendant guilty; defers acceptance of guilty plea in count 1 and approve DPA.  State confirms victim rights complied with, no victim impact statements, no restitution; recommendation 1 yr. probation, 5 days jail appropriate, defendant has no prior criminal history; requst no contact with Mark Hillestad, Brett Douglas, Devin Seiler, Jordan Meixner, Michael Bonn.  Atty Randtke requests expungement if successful completion, argues against 5 days jail.  Court withholds sentence and places defendant on 1 year probation with condition:  5 days jail; report 3/9 at noon; cooperate with any assessment or counseling as set up by P&P; demonstrate responsibility by seeking or maintaining full-time employement or education; provide a DNA sample; pay costs of case; no contact with named individuals; dismiss counts 3, 4, 5. Advised of appeal rights.

Defendant Maxwell Scott Holden in court with attorney S. Joseph Randtke.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel informs court of agreement, DPA in count 1, plead to count 2, State moves to dismiss counts 3-5.  Defendant waives right to a prelim. hrg. on record.  Court reviews WOPH with defendant and finds defendant's waiver of preliminary hearing done knowingly & voluntarily.

Adjourned initial appearance on February 14, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on March 6, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Maxwell Scott Holden in court with attorney S. Joseph Randtke.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties close to resolution.  See scheduling clerk for PH or cont'd INIT.  Any conditions of bond previously set are cont'd.
Adjourned initial appearance on January 17, 2017 at 01:15 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

Court confirms defendant received copy of criminal complaint, advises of charges/max. penalties and rights.  Defendant WTL for PH.  State requests $1000 Sign Bond with conditions:  No contact with JDM, CJM, BLR; no contact with co-defendants:  Mark Hillestad, Jordan Meixner, Brett Douglas, Michael Bonn, Devin Seiler.  Bond so set.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
